NTSE.conducting_body: NCERT (Stage 1 by States, Stage 2 by NCERT)

topics: Physics: Motion, Force, Optics, Electricity, Magnetism, Sound
Chemistry: Matter, Atoms, Molecules, Chemical Reactions, Acids-Bases, Periodic Table
Biology: Cell, Tissues, Life Processes, Control & Coordination, Reproduction, Heredity, Environment
History: French Revolution, Russian Revolution, Nationalism, Industrialization, World Wars
Geography: Resources, Agriculture, Manufacturing, India Physical Features, Climate
Civics: Democracy, Parliament, Constitution, Federalism, Rights
Economics: Development, Poverty, Food Security, Globalisation

Stage_1_State.marking: Each question 1 mark. No negative marking at Stage 1.
Stage_1_State.cutoff_note: State-level cutoff varies. Top ~1000 per state qualify for Stage 2.

Stage_2_National.marking: +1 correct, -1/3 wrong (negative marking applies at Stage 2)
Stage_2_National.important: Stage 2 has negative marking unlike Stage 1.

NTSE.question_style: All MCQ. 4 options (A) (B) (C) (D). One correct answer.
NTSE.paper_generation_note: When generating NTSE practice, create MAT and SAT as two separate papers. SAT must mix all three subjects in one paper with 40 Science + 40 Social Science + 20 Maths questions numbered sequentially.

sections.name: Section 2 — Science
sections.note: Syllabus exactly follows the NCERT/State board class curriculum for that year.

sections.name: Section 3 — Achiever's Section
sections.note: Higher order thinking. Challenging application-based questions from the same science syllabus.

NSO.question_style: All MCQ. 4 options. One correct answer.
NSO.paper_generation_note: Generate Section 1 (logical reasoning, 10Q), Section 2 (science chapter questions, 35Q), Section 3 (tough HOT questions, 5Q worth 3 marks each). Total 60 marks, 1 hour.

sections.name: Section 2 — Mathematical Reasoning
sections.note: Class syllabus-aligned mathematics questions. Conceptual and computational.

sections.name: Section 3 — Everyday Mathematics
sections.note: Word problems and real-life application of maths concepts.

sections.name: Section 4 — Achiever's Section
sections.note: High-difficulty maths questions requiring deep problem-solving. Often multi-step.

IMO.question_style: All MCQ. 4 options. One correct answer.
IMO.paper_generation_note: Generate Section 1 (logical reasoning, 10Q), Section 2 (maths syllabus, 25Q), Section 3 (application word problems, 10Q), Section 4 (HOT, 5Q × 3 marks). Total 60 marks.

IJSO.conducting_body: HBCSE (Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education) for Indian selection
IJSO.eligibility: Class 9 and below, age below 15 years

Stage_1_NSEJS.name: National Standard Examination in Junior Science
Stage_1_NSEJS.level: Class 10 NCERT level but with deep application

Stage_2_INJSO.name: Indian National Junior Science Olympiad
Stage_2_INJSO.theory: Written descriptive test. 3 hours. Sub-problems requiring derivation, numerical, diagram.

IJSO.question_style_stage1: All MCQ. +3/-1. Integrated science — single question may span physics+chemistry or chemistry+biology.
IJSO.paper_generation_note: For IJSO practice (Stage 1 NSEJS style): generate 80 MCQ questions mixing Physics (27), Chemistry (27), Biology (26). +3/-1 marking. Duration 2 Hours. Questions at Class 10 level but with high difficulty and application. Use 4 options per question.
